content.p: The Power Electronics, Machines and Control (PEMC) Research Institute is internationally renowned and one of the largest on its field. Comprising nearly 30 academic staff, around 70 Research Fellows and other research staff, over 100 PhD Students, 16 Technicians, and 20 Project Management and Administrative Staff; PEMC delivers high-impact teaching, research, and industrial collaborations. Read more about PEMC's Power Electronic Systems research Read more about PEMC's Electrical Machines development and research Read more about PEMC's Electric Motor Drives and Systems research Read more about PEMC's Power Electronic Integration research Facilities available at the Power Electronics and Machines Centre Read more about the projects PEMC is involved with
